title: Billionaire Cliff Asness to List Trophy Miami Penthouse for $29.5M
text:
A penthouse in Miami Beach, Florida, owned by billionaire hedge funder Cliff Asness is hitting the market for $29.5 million Tuesday, Mansion Global has exclusively learned.



Mr. Asness, 53, purchased the property via a limited liability company from Boris Jordan, a media mogul and financier of Russian origin, for $26 million in May 2018, property records show.



Mr. Asness co-founded AQR Capital Management in 1998, a Greenwich, Connecticut-based money management firm that overseas over $185 billion. He has an estimated net worth of $2.6 billion, according to Forbes.



Once the renovations on the penthouse were completed, Mr. Asness had a change of heart. He is now looking for a bigger place in Florida, according to listing agents Eloy Carmenate and Mick Duchon of Douglas Elliman. The duo also represented Mr. Asness as buyers agents in the 2018 transaction.



Mr. Asness didn’t respond to a request for comment sent to his firm.

Perched atop a nine-story boutique building on Ocean Drive, the penthouse has 6,807 square feet of interior living space, configured as five bedrooms, five full baths and two half baths. Terraces and rooftop spaces account for another 6,400 square feet, according to the listing agents.



The home comes with an infinity pool, an outdoor kitchen, a fire pit, and 360-degree views of the Atlantic Ocean and the Miami skyline, the listing agents said.



“The neighborhood is the most exclusive south of 5th Street in Miami, or even south of Manhattan,” Mr. Duchon said. “And a full-floor penthouse is a rare find in Miami Beach.”



Mr. Jordan, 53, bought the penthouse off the floor plan, before the boutique condominium was completed in 2014, for $20 million. He subsequently tried to flip it for $53 million in December 2015, Mansion Global previously reported. The asking price was reduced to just below $35 million in August 2017, and Mr. Asness bargained for a $9 million discount in May 2018.
